# Biomedical Waste Collection and Disposal Services

## Request for Proposal Title

The Department of Indigenous Services Canada (ISC) is seeking a biomedical waste collection and disposal service provider for nursing stations in four communities in Treaty 8, Alberta Region.

## Solicitation Number and Reference Number

Solicitation Number: 1000235391
Reference Number: PW-22-01009969

## Description of the Requirement

The First Nations and Inuit Health Branch (FNIHB) requires a provider to collect and dispose of biomedical waste from the nursing stations in accordance with applicable regulations. The contractor will be required to provide scheduled bi-weekly or monthly waste removal and disposal services.

## Special Requirements

*   Business must be certified under the Indigenous Business Directorate (IBD) of the Government of Canada and be listed in the Indigenous Business Directory.
*   Fox Lake Nursing Station requires special access arrangements during winter, spring, and autumn months.

## Notice

This RFP is conditionally set aside for Indigenous Businesses under the Federal Government's Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB).

## End Date and Evaluation Criteria

The RFP closing date is 2022-10-27T14:00:00. The evaluation will be based on the bidder's capability and performance in fulfilling the requirements as stated in this RFP.
